title: John Steven attacked with machete during cement fetish sex session | Metro News
text:
Ashitha Nagesh for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 12:56 pm John Steven, who was attacked (Picture: Mike Gibbons/Spindrift) 
A man was ambushed with a machete and left fighting for his life after arranging to have cement poured over him for sexual pleasure. 
John Steven had expected cement to be poured on him by escorts at a flat in Renfrewshire, Scotland, last March. 
But the 38-year-old was instead ambushed by convicted criminals Craig Dalton, 33, and Matthew Harrison, 23, who struck him with the blade and said he would be ‘chopped up’. Man with germ phobia loses licence because he won't blow into breathalyser 
John was terrified he was going to die as he desperately banged on a window, Glasgow’s High Court heard. 
The ordeal only finished when the pair fled, leaving a seriously wounded John to collapse on the street. 
Harrison admitted assaulting John to his severe injury, permanent disfigurement and impairment. 
Dalton pleaded guilty to the same charge, with the additional accusation that his role put the victim’s life in danger. Craig Dalton, who attacked John (Picture: Mike Gibbons/Spindrift) 
They have both been remanded in custody, and are facing hefty prison terms at their sentencing hearing next month. 
The court heard John had travelled from his home in Troon, Ayrshire, last March to meet 34-year-old Sharon Kerr – a woman whom he had known for around four years. Dog owners are more sexually attractive than people who own cats 
She ‘invited’ him back to her flat in Renfrew, where they discussed ‘services which were to be provided to him’. 
According to advocate depute Shanti Maguire, John went to get £150 cash and, after returning, was left with another woman called ‘Michelle’. 
It was shortly after this that Dalton and Harrison turned up and set upon the victim. 
‘He recalls Dalton saying, “There’s no way you’re getting out of here”,’ Ms Maguire said. ‘The victim was screaming and terrified that he was going to lose his life. He recalls shouting for help from his mum and trying to get out of the room.’ Sharon Kerr had arranged ‘services’ with John (Picture: Spindrift) 
During the attack John was forced to hand over his credit cards and PIN numbers to the pair. 
When Kerr returned and asked ‘What the hell’s happened?’, the two attackers fled, allowing John to finally escape. Pizza delivery driver leaves note offering 'weed, MDMA, pills, ket, raw coke & much more' 
The court heard he suffered a number of wounds to his hands, ear, cheek, chest and back, and that his left thumb was ‘almost severed’. He had to spend about 10 days in hospital recovering. 
Dalton and Harrison had originally been accused of attempted murder before prosecutors accepted their pleas to the reduced charge. 
Kerr also faced the same allegation, but prosecutors accepted her guilty pleas to stealing £400 from John’s bank account. 
Natalie Williamson was accused of attempted murder and conspiracy to rob John, but prosecutors accepted her not guilty plea. More
